intro: Chaetopappa, commonly known as the silky goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chaetopappa is adapted to thrive in dry conditions, making it a hardy species often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
